title: [Large-Scale] Workshop on Student-Centered English Teaching Methods and Language Assessment Design for 21st-Century Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic English language education experience, foundational digital literacy, and experience in teaching English grammar and vocabulary
context.additional_context: A course emphasizing the development of instructional design competencies applicable to real-world settings for current professionals. It focuses on designing teaching methodologies and assessment tools to enhance expressive skills, reading comprehension, and communication abilities in English language education contexts.

learning_goals: Learners can design integrated English speaking/writing lesson plans using student-centered learning (SCL) strategies.
Learners can develop English communication skill enhancement modules reflecting 21st-century competencies (creativity, critical thinking, collaboration) through project-based assessments.
Learners can apply methodologies to design smartphone-based language learning activities (e.g., audio recording, text collaboration) in resource-constrained technological environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
